c74object.name: bach.coprimeser
c74object.description: Finds all the numbers M smaller than the absolute value of a given number N, such that M and N are coprime.

outlet.description: The output is the list of all numbers smaller than N and coprime with N

objarg.name: maximum
objarg.description: An integer as argument sets the number N (maximum number for the series, which in turns will never be reached, since it is not coprime with itself).

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the coprime number series for the most recently received input maximum number N.

method.name: int
method.description: An integer in the inlet will set the number N (maximum number for the series, which in turns will never be reached, since it is not coprime with itself).

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: The abstraction is a based on bach.coprime.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Coprime number series.. The output is the list of all numbers smaller than N and coprime with N

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The abstraction is a based on bach.coprime.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: coprime, prime, number, greatest common divisor, series, sequence.
